summary: The diff applies a new CSS background utility class and attaches it to the app root, but it does not add the required generated image asset file. The diff also appears to introduce/modify UI content and broader theming changes that go beyond the request to only apply a background.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the generated background image(s) as static frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filename(s) specified, and reference them from styling.
missing_requirements.reason: No new files were added in the diff, so the required static asset `frontend/public/assets/generated/dance-background.dim_1920x1080.png` is not present. Without the file, the CSS reference risks a missing-asset build/runtime error.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add a dance-themed background to the main page that includes both Bollywood and Bharatanatyam elements behind existing content without changing functionality.
missing_requirements.reason: While styling is added to apply a background behind content, the actual required image asset is not included in the diff, so the background cannot be confirmed to load or to contain the specified Bollywood+Bharatanatyam visual cues.

hallucinated_features.description: Addition/expansion of a dance style selector UI (dropdown, helper text, and conditional info cards) rather than only applying a background.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly states non-goals: no new UI features beyond applying the requested background. The diff shows substantial UI logic and content in App.tsx (state, Select dropdown, conditional text/cards).
evidence: frontend/src/App.tsx (adds useState selectedStyle, Select dropdown, helper text "Currently selected:", and conditional content blocks)

hallucinated_features.description: Global theme/palette changes (OKLCH variables for warm palette; dark mode adjustments) beyond the requested background application.
hallucinated_features.reason: The request focuses on adding a background image and ensuring readability via overlay/opacity/blur, but the diff also changes many global CSS variables for colors and charts, which is broader than necessary for the background requirement.
evidence: frontend/src/index.css (:root and .dark blocks redefine many design tokens like --primary, --chart-1..5, etc.)

hallucinated_features.description: Tailwind configuration extensions (custom border radius, shadows, Inter font family).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; the change summary indicates Tailwind config was modified to support a cohesive design system, which is outside the scoped request to apply a background only.
